document_data.name: Kestor
document_data.mainbody: '''Kestor''' was a [[half-elf|half-elven]] merchant who dealt in silks, textiles and spices in [[Baldur's Gate]]  during the 14{{th}} century [[DR]]. He was both a member of the city's [[Merchant's League]] as well as an agent of the [[Knights of the Shield]].
document_data.Activities: The half-elven trader owned a merchant fleet that brought in silks and spices from many exotic countries, like [[Halruaa]], [[Balduran (city)|Balduran]] in [[Chult]], [[Dambrath]], [[Nimbral]], and [[Tashalar]]. He was one of the few non-[[Calishite]] proponents of the idea that the Knights needed to work with the [[Rundeen]].
document_data.Relationships: Kestor had a very long history of rivalry with [[Aldeth Sashenstar]] and used all of his and the Knights' resources to try to ruin his rival.
document_data.History:
During the [[iron crisis]] of [[1368 DR]], Kestor and his fellow Knight of the Shield agent [[Tuth]] took a meeting with [[Rieltar Anchev]] and [[Brunos Costak]] of the [[Iron Throne]], within the fortress-library of [[Candlekeep]].

Having invested a great deal of money in the colony of [[Fort Flame]], Kestor it all when the [[sahuagin]] destroyed it the settlement in [[1369 DR]].
